conclusion: Liquid will flow from points A, B, and C through baffles to containers D or E.
Points A, B, and C are at the top marked with red arrows; points D and E are at the bottom marked with red arrows.
Colored bars on the black background are baffles that will redirect the liquid.
Liquid will flow downward due to gravity.
Starting from A (yellow marker at top), liquid drops downward.
Liquid from A will first encounter the brown baffle angled diagonally.
Liquid from A will be deflected to the left and downward.
Liquid from A will likely hit the black baffle.
Black baffle will further redirect liquid from A left and down.
Liquid from A will continue to the left side of the board.
Liquid from A leads toward container D.
Starting from B (teal/turquoise marker at top), liquid drops downward.
Liquid from B will first hit the teal baffle angled diagonally.
Teal baffle redirects liquid from B to the right and downward.
Liquid from B may then interact with the purple baffle.
Purple baffle continues liquid from B right and down.
Liquid from B leads toward container E.
Starting from C (orange marker at top), liquid drops straight down.
Liquid from C will encounter the white horizontal baffle.
After hitting the white baffle, liquid from C will continue downward.
Liquid from C directs toward the right side.
Liquid from C leads to container E.
Liquid from point A will flow into container D.
Liquid from point B will flow into container E.
Liquid from point C will flow into container E.
